description: Ms. codex. Title from leaf 1b. Physical description: 19 lines per page; written in small naskh in black on machine-made paper. Spaces left for rubrication not filled in. Occasional staining. Back cover detached. Origin: Jumādá I 1272 H [January-February 1856] in Mashhad, by Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad al-madʻū bi-Ṣādiq (leaf 210a). Incipit: الحمد لله ... في الاجماع [ ... ] اختلفوا في حقيقة الاجماع لغة
author: Kirbāsī, Muḥammad ibn Ibrāhīm, 1766 or 1767-1844
abstract: Volume 2 of a treatise on uṣūl al-fiqh, comprising al-ijmāʻ through al-iḥtiyāṭ.
extent: 210 leaves : paper ; 215 x 151 (151 x 84) mm bound to 221 x 155 mm
provenance: On leaf 1a, owner's note and stamp of the scribe. Other owners' stamps on leaves 1a, 1b.
dlme_provenance_en: On leaf 1a, owner's note and stamp of the scribe. Other owners' stamps on leaves 1a, 1b.
creator: Kirbāsī, Muḥammad ibn Ibrāhīm, 1766 or 1767-1844
كرباسي، محمد بن ابراهيم، 1766 or 1767-1844
subject: Islamic law—Interpretation and construction
binding_note: Full black leather with blind-stamped central mandorla, pendants, and fillets; red paper doublures.
member_of_collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
